get.summary:
Returns the folders the current user has access to.
The response will be a list of folders; the hierarchy can be reconstructed
using the ParentId properties. From the root to the folders the user has
actually been assigned to, the folders will be marked as non-selectable
and only the paths to the assigned-to folders will be included.
From the assigned-to folders down to the leaves, the nodes will be marked as
selectable and their children lists fully populated.
get.description:
Client Credentials Flow required permissions: Forbidden or Forbidden.Read.

Requires authentication.

get.summary:
Returns a page of the user-folder assignments for the input user, including the roles for each folder.
The response also includes the folders assigned to the directory groups of the user.
The distinction between the folders assigned directly to the user and the ones assigned to one of his groups
can be made via the User field of the response.
get.description:
Client Credentials Flow required permissions: Forbidden or Forbidden.Read.

Required permissions: (Units.View - Gets roles from all folders) and (SubFolders.View - Gets roles only from folders where caller has SubFolders.View permission) and (Users.View and Roles.View).

parameters.description: User name

post.summary: Inserts a log entry with a specified message in JSON format.

Required permissions: (Logs.Create).

Example of jMessage parameter.
            
     {
         "message": "TTT execution started",
         "level": "Information",
         "timeStamp": "2017-01-18T14:46:07.4152893+02:00",
         "windowsIdentity": "DESKTOP-1L50L0P\\WindowsUser",
         "agentSessionId": "00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000",
         "processName": "TTT",
         "fileName": "Main",
         "jobId": "8066c309-cef8-4b47-9163-b273fc14cc43"
     }

get.summary: Called by RobotSvc to connect the Robots on the machine it is running on to Orchestrator (under automatic deployment).
get.description:
This is the initial handshake between the robot service and Orchestrator, the equivalent of configuring the connection
            info from Robot tray (manual deployment). It is supported only for authorized machines, i.e. the robot machine is part of the
            same AD as Orchestrator. To enforce this, the request must contain the machine identity. The robots must be already provisioned
            in Orchestrator before this step, otherwise RobotSvc will continue to call this method until they are.

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: The tenant under which already defined robots are searched for.

parameters.name: domainName
parameters.description: Domain name for the machine where robot is installed. If it's not provided, we'll use the one specified in web.config

401.description: Calling machine is not part of the same AD

post.summary: Post to the server a collection of heartbeat messages generated by the Robots from a Machine
post.description:
Every 30 seconds the UiPath service running on a Robot Machine posts a collection of heartbeat messages (one for each Robot hosted on the Machine).
The response is a collection of commands specific to all the Robots defined on that Machine, including the ones that were added in the meanwhile.

400.description: hbts is null or empty or an Exception is thrown during insert

post.summary: Acquires licensing runtimes, updates machine's session state and reporting time.
post.description:

The response is a collection of commands specific to that machine.

If the received payload contains the ServiceUserName, it returns only the Robot with that specific UserName.

400.description: No Robots meet the criteria or an Exception is thrown during retrieval

If scope is 0 (Global), the default values will be the initial ones. If scope is 1 (Robot), then
the default values will be the actual values set globally.

Then within the config returned by this function, the default value for this setting will be:

IsProcessDeleted.description: States whether the process associated with the release is deleted or not.

JobDto.description: Represents a scheduled or manual execution of a process on a robot.

StartTime.description: The date and time when the job execution started or null if the job hasn't started yet.

EndTime.description: The date and time when the job execution ended or null if the job hasn't ended yet.

State.description: The state in which the job is.

Source.description: The Source name of the job.

SourceType.description: The Source type of the job.

OrganizationUnitFullyQualifiedName.description: Fully qualified name of the folder this job is part of.

StartProcessDto.description: The Start Process transfers information from client to the server during JobsController.StartJobs custom action.

ReleaseKey.description: The unique key of the release associated with the process.

Strategy.description: States which robots from the environment are being run by the process.

RobotIds.description: The collection of ids of specific robots selected to be run by the current process. This collection must be empty only if the start strategy is not Specific.

MachineSessionIds.description: The machines used for running the job. If empty, the job will start on the first available machine

NoOfRobots.description: DEPRECATED. Number of pending jobs to be created in the environment, for the current process. This number must be greater than 0 only if the start strategy is RobotCount.

JobsCount.description: Number of pending jobs to be created in the environment, for the current process. This number must be greater than 0 only if the start strategy is JobsCount.

Source.description: The Source of the job starting the current process.

JobPriority.description: Execution priority. If null, defaults to the JobPriority of its release.

InputArguments.description: Input parameters in JSON format to be passed to job execution.

JobTriggerDto.description: A trigger for resuming a job

Name.description: The name of the Machine a Robot is hosted on.

UserDto.description: Stores information about assigned role(s) and email settings, and enables a person or a Robot to login to Orchestrator.

Name.description: The name of the person for which the user is created.

Surname.description: The surname of the person for which the user is created.

UserName.description: The name used to login to Orchestrator.

FullName.description: The full name of the person constructed with the format Name Surname.

EmailAddress.description: The e-mail address associated with the user.

IsEmailConfirmed.description: States if the email address is valid or not.

LastLoginTime.description: The date and time when the user last logged in, or null if the user never logged in.

UserRoles.description: The collection of roles associated with the user.

TenancyName.description: The name of the tenant owning the user.

TenantKey.description: The key of the tenant owning the user.

MayHaveUserSession.description: Specifies whether this user is allowed to have a User session (default: true)

MayHaveRobotSession.description: Specifies whether this user is allowed to have an Attended Robot attached (default: true)

Description.description: The description of the robot that runs the job.

ProcessScheduleDto.description: Defines the schedule of a process that can be executed at regular intervals, on selected Robots, all of them or a specified number of Robots.

Enabled.description: Specifies if the schedule is active or not.

Name.description: The name of the schedule.

ReleaseId.description: The Id of the process associated with the schedule.

ReleaseKey.description: The unique key of the process associated with the schedule.

ReleaseName.description: The name of the process associated with the schedule.

PackageName.description: The name of the package to be triggered with the schedule.

EnvironmentName.description: The name of the environment associated with the schedule.

EnvironmentId.description: The Id of the environment associated with the schedule.

JobPriority.description: The execution priority. If null, it will start jobs with the release's priority.

RuntimeType.description: The runtime type of the robot

StartProcessCron.description: The start cron expression of the schedule.

StartProcessCronDetails.description: Various details that can be associated to the time period expression of the schedule.

StartProcessCronSummary.description: Human readable form of cron expression of the schedule.

StartProcessNextOccurrence.description: The date and time when the associated process will be run next.

StartStrategy.description: States which robots from the environment are being run by the schedule.

ExecutorRobots.description: The collection of specific robots selected to be targeted by the current schedule. This collection must be empty if the start strategy is not 0 (specific robots).

StopProcessExpression.description: The cron expression after which a running process will be stopped.

StopStrategy.description: The way a running process is stopped.

ExternalJobKey.description: The unique identifier of the external job associated with the jobs generated by this schedule. A key is generated for each group of jobs triggered by this schedule.

UseCalendar.description: DEPRECATED. Specify whether the schedule uses any calendar.

InputArguments.description: Input parameters that will be passed to each job created by this schedule.

ItemsPerJobActivationTarget.description: The target ratio between the number of queue items and the Total number of jobs created by a process.

MaxJobsForActivation.description: The maximum number of jobs that a process can create as result of a Queue driven activation.

QueueDefinitionDto.description: The definition of a work queue. A work queue contains work items that are processed by robots.

Description.description: Used to add additional information about a queue in order to better identify it.

EnforceUniqueReference.description: States whether Item Reference field should be unique per Queue. Deleted and retried items are not checked against this rule.

ReleaseId.description: The ProcessId Queue is associated with.

OrganizationUnitId.description: Id of the folder this queue is part of.

OrganizationUnitFullyQualifiedName.description: Fully qualified name of the folder this queue is part of.

QueueItemDto.description:
Defines a piece of data that can be processed by a robot and the information associated with its processing status.
<para />Queue items are grouped in queues.

QueueDefinitionId.description: The Id of the parent queue.

SpecificContent.description: A collection of key value pairs containing custom data configured in the Add Queue Item activity, in UiPath Studio.

Output.description: A collection of key value pairs containing custom data resulted after successful processing.

OutputData.description: A JSON representation of the output data generated by the item's processing.

Analytics.description: A collection of key value pairs containing custom data for further analytics processing.

AnalyticsData.description: A JSON representation of the analytics data generated by the item's processing.

Status.description: The processing state of the item.

ReviewStatus.description: The review state of the item - applicable only for failed items.

ReviewerUserId.description: The UserId of the Reviewer, if any.

Key.description: The unique identifier of a queue item.

Reference.description: An optional, user-specified value for queue item identification.

ProcessingExceptionType.description: The processing exception. If the item has not been processed or has been processed successfully it will be null.

DueDate.description: The latest date and time at which the item should be processed. If empty the item can be processed at any given time.

RiskSlaDate.description: The RiskSla date at time which is considered as risk zone for the item to be processed.

Priority.description: Sets the processing importance for a given item.

DeferDate.description: The earliest date and time at which the item is available for processing. If empty the item can be processed as soon as possible.

StartProcessing.description: The date and time at which the item processing started. This is null if the item was not processed.

EndProcessing.description: The date and time at which the item processing ended. This is null if the item was not processed.

SecondsInPreviousAttempts.description: The number of seconds that the last failed processing lasted.

AncestorId.description: The Id of an ancestor item connected to the current item.

RetryNumber.description:
The number of times this work item has been processed.
<para />This can be higher than 0 only if MaxRetried number is set and the item processing failed at least once with ApplicationException.

SpecificData.description: A JSON representation of the specific content.

CreationTime.description: The date and time when the item was created.

Progress.description: String field which is used to keep track of the business flow progress.

RowVersion.description: Identifier used for optimistic concurrency, so Orchestrator can figure whether data is out of date or not.

OrganizationUnitId.description: Id of the folder this item is part of.

OrganizationUnitFullyQualifiedName.description: Fully qualified name of the folder this item is part of.

Name.description: The name of the queue into which the item will be added.

Priority.description: Sets the processing importance for a given item.

SpecificContent.description: A collection of key value pairs containing custom data configured in the Add Queue Item activity, in UiPath Studio.

DeferDate.description: The earliest date and time at which the item is available for processing. If empty the item can be processed as soon as possible.

DueDate.description: The latest date and time at which the item should be processed. If empty the item can be processed at any given time.

RiskSlaDate.description: The RiskSla date at time which is considered as risk zone for the item to be processed.

Reference.description: An optional, user-specified value for queue item identification.

Progress.description: String field which is used to keep track of the business flow progress.

QueueProcessingRecordDto.description: Stores aggregated report information about the processing status of all the items from a given queue in a specific time period.

QueueDefinitionId.description: The Id of the queue for which the report is done.

ProcessingTime.description: The date and time when the report is computed.

ReportType.description: The aggregation period used in the report.

NumberOfInProgressTransactions.description: The number of items in progress.

NumberOfApplicationExceptions.description: The total number of application exceptions thrown while processing queue items in the given time period.

NumberOfBusinessExceptions.description: The total number of business exceptions thrown while processing queue items in the given time period.

NumberOfSuccessfulTransactions.description: The total number of successfully processed queue items in the given time period.

NumberOfRetriedItems.description: The total number of processing retries occurred in the given time period.

ApplicationExceptionsProcessingTime.description: The total number of seconds spent processing queue items that failed with application exception in the given time period.

BusinessExceptionsProcessingTime.description: The total number of seconds spent processing queue items that failed with business exception in the given time period.

SuccessfulTransactionsProcessingTime.description: The total number of seconds spent processing successful queue items in the given time period.

TotalNumberOfTransactions.description: The total number of item processing transactions, both failed and successful.

TenantId.description: The Id of the queue tenant.

QueueProcessingStatusDto.description: Stores aggregated report information about the processing status of all the items from a given queue.

ItemsToProcess.description: The total number of items in the queue with the status New.

ItemsInProgress.description: The total number of items in the queue with the status InProgress.

QueueDefinitionId.description: The Id of the queue for which the report is done.

QueueDefinitionName.description: The name of the queue for which the report is done.

QueueDefinitionDescription.description: The description of the queue for which the report is done.

QueueDefinitionAcceptAutomaticallyRetry.description: States whether the queue accepts automatic item retry or not.

QueueDefinitionMaxNumberOfRetries.description: The maximum number of retries allowed for any item of the queue.

QueueDefinitionEnforceUniqueReference.description: States whether Item Reference field should be unique per Queue. Deleted and retried items are not checked against this rule.

ProcessingMeanTime.description: The average time spent processing a successful item.

SuccessfulTransactionsNo.description: The total number of successfully processed items.

ApplicationExceptionsNo.description: The total number of application exceptions thrown while processing queue items.

BusinessExceptionsNo.description: The total number of business exceptions thrown while processing queue items.

SuccessfulTransactionsProcessingTime.description: The total number of seconds spent processing successful queue items.

ApplicationExceptionsProcessingTime.description: The total number of seconds spent processing queue items that failed with application exception.

BusinessExceptionsProcessingTime.description: The total number of seconds spent processing queue items that failed with business exception.

TotalNumberOfTransactions.description: The total number of item processing transactions, both failed and successful.

LastProcessed.description: The date and time of the last item processing.

ReleaseName.description: The name of the process associated with the queue.

SpecificDataJsonSchemaExists.description: Optional JSON schema enforced onto the specific data field is set.

OutputDataJsonSchemaExists.description: Optional JSON schema enforced onto the output data field is set.

AnalyticsDataJsonSchemaExists.description: Optional JSON schema enforced onto the analytics data field is set.

ProcessScheduleId.description: The Id of the process schedule associated with the queue.

TransactionResultDto.description: Stores data sent when processing an item ended.

IsSuccessful.description: States if the processing was successful or not.

DeferDate.description: The earliest date and time at which the item is available for processing. If empty the item can be processed as soon as possible.

DueDate.description: The latest date and time at which the item should be processed. If empty the item can be processed at any given time.

Output.description: A collection of key value pairs containing custom data resulted after successful processing.

Analytics.description: A collection of key value pairs containing custom data for further analytics processing.

Progress.description: String field which is used to keep track of the business flow progress.

Ordinal.description:
Ordinal of the item that failed.
A value of null means that offending item is unknown.

TransactionDataDto.description: Stores data sent when processing of an existing or a new item starts.

Name.description: The name of the queue in which to search for the next item or in which to insert the item before marking it as InProgress and sending it to the robot.

RobotIdentifier.description: The unique key identifying the robot that sent the request.

SpecificContent.description:
If not null a new item will be added to the queue with this content before being moved to InProgress state and returned to the robot for processing.
<para />If null the next available item in the list will be moved to InProgress state and returned to the robot for processing.

DeferDate.description: The earliest date and time at which the item is available for processing. If empty the item can be processed as soon as possible.

DueDate.description: The latest date and time at which the item should be processed. If empty the item can be processed at any given time.

Reference.description: An optional, user-specified value for queue item identification.

Key.description: A unique identifier associated to each release.

ProcessVersion.description: The version of the process associated with the release.

LogDto.description:
Logs generated by Robots and execution reports. Can be stored in ElasticSearch and/or to a local SQL database.
<para />Note: The endpoint for this type is /odata/RobotLogs URL.

WindowsIdentity.description: The name of the user that performed the action that was logged.

TimeStamp.description: The exact date and time the action was performed.

Message.description: The log message. This can also be a message logged through the Log Message activity in UiPath Studio.

JobKey.description: The key of the job running the process that generated the log, if any.

RawMessage.description: A JSON format message containing all the above fields.

RobotName.description: The name of the Robot that generated the log.

MachineId.description: The Id of the Machine on which the Robot that generated the log is running.

RoleDto.description: A role acts as a grouping of permissions. Roles are associated with users to provide application authorization.

Name.description: A custom name for the role.

DisplayName.description: An alternative name used for UI display.

IsStatic.description: States whether this role is defined by the application and cannot be deleted or it is user defined and can be deleted.

IsEditable.description: States whether the permissions for this role can be modified or not.

Permissions.description: The collection of application permissions associated with the role.

RobotLicenseDto.description: Entity that represents an acquired Robot license

Timestamp.description: The date when the license was acquired

The key is automatically generated from the server for the Robot machine.
<para />For the robot to work, the same key must exist on both the robot and Orchestrator.
<para />All robots on a machine must have the same license key in order to register correctly.
